00027 #ifndef _FEATURE_VECTOR_H_
00028 #define _FEATURE_VECTOR_H_
00029 
00030 // Include STL binary predicates
00031 #include <functional>
00032 
00042 template <typename T, const unsigned int D>
00043 struct feature_vector {
00044 
00046         T data[D];
00047 
00048         // Constructors
00049         feature_vector() {}                                                             
00050         feature_vector(T value) { for(unsigned int d=0; d<D; ++d) data[d] = value; }    
00051         
00052         // Subscript operators
00053         const T & operator [] (unsigned int index) const { return data[index]; }        
00054         T & operator [] (unsigned int index) { return data[index]; }                    
00055 
00056         // Squared distance operators for two D-dimensional points of type T.
00057         inline T distance_to(const feature_vector &p) const;                    
00058         inline T distance_to(const feature_vector &p, T upper_bound) const;     
00059 
00060         // Memory operators: used to allow memory-aligned specializations. For example, for SSE optimizations.
00061         void *operator new [] (size_t size);    
00062         void  operator delete [] (void *p);     
00063 
00064 } __attribute__((packed));
00065 
00073 template <typename T>
00074 struct vector_distance : public std::binary_function <vector_distance<T>, vector_distance<T>, bool> {
00075 
00076         unsigned int index;     
00077         T squared_distance;     
00078 
00079         // Default and convenience constructors
00080         vector_distance() {}
00081         vector_distance(unsigned int index, T squared_distance) : index(index), squared_distance(squared_distance) {}
00082 
00084         bool operator () (const vector_distance &v1, const vector_distance &v2) const {
00085                 return v1.squared_distance < v2.squared_distance;
00086         }
00087 };
00088 
00089 // Template implementation
00090 #include "feature_vector.cpp"
00091 
00092 #endif
